definition.name: Azure SQL Deploy
definition.description: Deploy a database project, DACPAC, or a SQL script to Azure SQL database

inputs.name: connection-string
inputs.description: The connection string, including authentication information, for the Azure SQL Server database.

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Path to the file used for this action. Supported file types are .sql, .dacpac, or .sqlproj.

inputs.name: action
inputs.description: If not using a .sql file, the sqlpackage action to execute.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.description: In case of .dacpac or .sqlproj file types, additional sqlpackage arguments that will be applied. In case of .sql file type, additional go-sqlcmd argument that will be applied.

inputs.name: sqlpackage-path
inputs.description: Specify a SqlPackage executable location to override the default locations.

inputs.name: build-arguments
inputs.description: In case of a .sqlproj file, additional arguments that will be applied to dotnet build when building the database project.

inputs.name: skip-firewall-check
inputs.description: Skip the firewall check when connecting to the Azure SQL Server.

evidence.reasoning: The action is primarily focused on deploying database projects or scripts to Azure SQL, which falls under the Deployment category. It also involves infrastructure as it interacts with Azure SQL databases.
